title: 113_hr4374
content: The Act titled "Biological Implant Tracking and Veteran Safety Act of 2014" requires the identification and tracking of biological implants used in Department of Veterans Affairs medical facilities. The "Biological Implant Tracking and Veteran Safety Act of 2014" mandates the adoption of a standard identification system for biological implants in VA medical facilities. This system will track implants from donor to implantation, ensuring compatibility with existing identification systems. The Secretary must implement inventory controls compatible with the tracking system for biological implants subject to recall by the FDA in VA medical facilities. If deemed appropriate, patients must be notified of recalls based on risk evaluations. In case of conflicts, this section must align with FDA regulations. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act or Public Health Service Act regulations apply to biological implants, defined as human cell or tissue products regulated under FDA guidelines. A clerical amendment is made to include this definition in the relevant chapter. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must implement a standard identification system for biological implants within 180 days of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to adopt a standard identification system for biological implants in compliance with FDA regulations. Additionally, a biological implant tracking system must be implemented within 180 days of the Act's enactment. If the tracking system is not operational by this deadline, a reporting requirement is triggered. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide monthly written explanations to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding impediments to implementing the biological implant tracking system, steps taken to address them, and target dates for solutions, until the system is operational. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide monthly written explanations to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding impediments to implementing the biological implant tracking system, steps taken to address them, and target dates for solutions, until the system is operational. This pertains to the procurement of biological implants used in Department of Veterans Affairs medical facilities. The Secretary may procure biological implants only from vendors meeting specific conditions, including using a standard identification system and being registered with the FDA. The vendor must use registered tissue distribution intermediaries, ensure donor eligibility records accompany each implant, consent to inspections by the Department of Veterans Affairs, and cooperate with implant recalls. The vendor must comply with FDA regulations, report adverse events, retain records for five years, and maintain accreditation with a recognized organization for biological implants procurement. The Secretary will use Federal Supply Schedules for procurement unless not available. The Secretary will accommodate vendor requests to educate medical professionals about biological implants listed on Federal Supply Schedules. Section 8123 does not apply to the procurement of biological implants. If unavailable on the schedules, competitive procedures will be used for procurement. Penalties apply to Department procurement employees who violate requirements. Penalties apply to individuals who violate the requirements regarding biological implants, leading to ineligibility for certain roles. Definitions for 'biological implant' and 'production identifier' are provided in this section. The text discusses requirements for biological implants and includes a clerical amendment to the table of sections. Section 8129 of title 38, United States Code, pertains to the procurement of biological implants. It specifies that the effective date of this section will be 180 days after the implementation of a tracking system required under another section. Additionally, there is a special rule for cryopreserved products allowing for the procurement of biological implants produced before the effective date without relabeling.
